section.heading: Opinion Announcement of Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Mr. Justice Brennan has the dispositions to announce in two cases.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: The first is 75-5027 which is here from the Supreme Court of Minnesota.

This case was brought by a Chippewa Indian, protesting that the State of Minnesota had no jurisdiction to levy a property tax on his mobile home located on land held in by the United States in trust for members of the Chippewa tribe.
The Minnesota courts held that, they did indeed, State did indeed have taxing authority that it had that authority accredited by an act of Congress Section 4 (a) of Public Law 280.
We don't read Public Law 280 as did the Minnesota courts, and we therefore, reverse on the ground that the state did not have authority to impose a property tax on petitioner's on mobile home.
